Given vertices are: A(_{i}_,_{j}_), B(_{k}_,_{l}_) and C(_{m}_,_{n}_).
Now Using following formula:
Area = \({1\over 2}\times (x_1(y_2-y_3)+x_2(y_3-y_1)+x_3(y_1-y_2))\)
i.e., Area = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{l}_-_{n}_)+_{k}_(_{n}_-_{j}_)+_{m}_(_{j}_-_{l}_))\)
i.e., Area = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{{l-n}}_)+_{k}_(_{{n-j}}_)+_{m}_(_{{j-l}}_))\)
i.e., Area = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{i*(l-n)}}_+_{{k*(n-j)}}_+_{{m*(j-l)}}_)\)
i.e., Area = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{(i*(l-n))+(k*(n-j))+(m*(j-l))}}_)\)
i.e., Area = \(_{{trunc(((Decimal(i)*(l-n))+(k*(n-j))+(m*(j-l)))/2,2)}}_\)
Since area is a measured quantity, which can not be negative,we will take the numerical value.
Therefore area = \(_{{trunc(-((Decimal(i)*(l-n))+(k*(n-j))+(m*(j-l)))/2,2)}}_\) Square unit.
